page.title: 02CAMBORNE'S HISTORY
page.content: Cambornes parish church is dedicated to{St.Martin}& also{St.Meriadocus}who came from Brittany.It is thought that {the name Camborne originated from his {surname "de Campbon". The parish church is one of the few old buildings in Camborne.It was {restored in 1862}&{made larger in {1879.}It retains many historical features like its{14th Century {architecture.}The stone altar is of 10th Century origin & supposed to be the{oldest of its kind in Cornwall. Other buildings:an 18th Century hall at Lower Roswarne situated in the northen region of Camborne. At Magor in{1931 a Roman Villa was {discovered,}it is the most westerly in Britain and is thought to date from the 2nd Century.The Hut Circles at Caerwynnen Hill are even older than the villa.
